name: forcefully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a strong way that demands attention or action: argue forcefully He argued forcefully that stricter laws were necessary to deal with the problem. What struck me most forcefully was that people really do think that price equals quality.
using great physical strength or violence: He once hit a teammate so forcefully that the poor guy flew backward into his locker. He was treated disrespectfully and forcefully removed from the office. See
forceful
More examplesFewer examplesThe claim is due to be forcefully challenged by lawyers acting for the families of the missing crew.They have forcefully told the decision-makers to rethink the idea.Dust storms normally start in the spring and early summer when the winds are blowing more forcefully.
